title: Superman Comic Found in Attic Sells for Millions
summary: Three brothers found a very old Superman comic book in their mom's attic in California. It was from 1939 and was in great condition. They sold it at an auction for $9.12 million, which is the most money ever paid for a comic book. Their mom had kept it since she was young, and the cool weather helped keep it safe. This comic is special because it's one of the first Superman stories. The brothers were surprised and happy about their find. It shows how valuable old comics can be if they are taken care of properly. This story is exciting for comic book fans everywhere.

An auction is when people offer money to buy something, and the highest bidder wins. Old things can be valuable if they are rare and in good condition. This story shows how a family found a treasure in their home.
